image.altText: Genetic Testing

props.synopsis: Life insurers and those offering income protection and permanent disability insurance will be banned from using genetic testing to refuse cover after a government crackdown.

title.children: Genetic testing to be banned from life insurance, income protection, disability cover

image.altText: A piece of paper with a ruler on it, with a yellow pill sitting in the middle.

props.synopsis: A highly-potent opioid substance has been detected by Canberra's drug checking service in a counterfeit pill purchased on the dark web.

title.children: Highly potent opioid 100 times stronger than fentanyl detected in Canberra

image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: ACT police said two children were in their mother's car on Monday when she allegedly tried to run over her former partner twice.

title.children: Woman arrested after allegedly trying to run over former partner twice on Canberra street

image.altText: Police and police tape at the scene of an incident on a road.

props.synopsis: Police say the 31-year-old man was declared dead shortly after being transported to hospital in critical condition, following witness reports he fell from a moving vehicle on Anzac Parade in Canberra.

title.children: Man dies after reportedly falling from moving vehicle in Canberra

image.altText: Raw vanadium rock

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton and Resources Minister Madeline King will make duelling pitches to the Minerals Council of Australia, with the opposition leader promising to "turbocharge" mining and energy projects and overturn or restrict environmental decisions.

title.children: I'll be the best friend you ever had, Peter Dutton promises miners

image.altText: Kikkert

props.synopsis: Just weeks out from the October election, the Canberra Liberals have dumped MLA Elizabeth Kikkert, saying they acted on allegations about donations and electoral expenditure obligations and "workplace behaviour''.

title.children: Canberra Liberals disendorse MLA Elizabeth Kikkert, alleging concerns about donations and 'workplace behaviour'

image.altText: Two young boys and a woman pose in an front of a tree with yellow leaves. The faces of the boys and the woman are blurred.

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed the two children, aged nine and 11, were found dead west of Sydney.

title.children: 'As tragic as it gets': Two boys found dead, mother arrested in Blue Mountains

image.altText: A boy on a surfboard paddling in the water.

props.synopsis: Locals who saw the door from a small plane plummet towards a Far South Coast beach, landing just metres from a fisherman, say it was "a crazy situation to witness".

title.children: Surfers stunned as plane door falls from sky and narrowly misses fisher on NSW beach

image.altText: Three girls in school uniforms smile while holding their smartphones.

props.synopsis: Regular use of some social media platforms is negatively impacting the life satisfaction of Australian teenagers, according to the latest findings from the nation's largest survey of young people. But there is nuance in the findings.

title.children: Study finds regular use of social media harming teens' life satisfaction

props.synopsis: The Canberra Liberals commit to delivering a new 30,000-seat stadium at Acton Waterfront if they are successful in next month's ACT election.

title.children: 'You can't just plonk a stadium anywhere': Labor dismisses city stadium plan from Canberra Liberals

image.altText: Portrait of a man on a bicycle on a footpath.

props.synopsis: Safety concerns about cracked footpaths and poor street lighting have led some Canberrans to question what they're getting for their rates.

title.children: 'It broke my bike. It broke me': These Canberra ratepayers want their footpaths fixed

image.altText: Composite image of a man wearing a suit and tie, and an image of race horses and money

props.synopsis: Paul Montgomery was brought in by these brothers as a trusted friend to run the financial side of their business but as they made him general manager, he stole millions, was duchessed by gambling company VIPs and lost it all while on a multi-million dollar losing streak.

title.children: 'The Golden Goose' that cooked the books, a business and lifelong friendships as he gambled the millions he stole

image.altText: A wom and man in formal clothes and sunglasses walking

props.synopsis: Families have told a sentencing hearing for a bus driver who caused a fatal crash in the NSW Hunter Valley that their lives have been "shattered".

title.children: Hunter crash survivor details 'overwhelming sensation I was going to die' in emotional hearing

image.altText: A white box of illegal Manchester cigarettes in a black bag.

props.synopsis: For the past decade, plain-packaging laws and steep tax increases have helped to reduce the national smoking rate, but a booming black market has led some to question whether the federal government's policy is still working.

title.children: Tobacco retail sales plummeting but not because people have quit smoking

image.altText: Consumer groups letter to federal treasurer and drone image of Sydney suburb

props.synopsis: Choice and the Owners Corporation Network are among the consumer groups that have endorsed an open letter to the federal treasurer calling for urgent action.

title.children: 'Tip of the iceberg': Top consumer groups demand urgent federal inquiry into strata industry

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks into the camera with a pained expression.

props.synopsis: Alison Whitfield's husband Dave, a veteran medic with the Australian Defence Force, took his own life earlier this year. She desperately hopes other families do not have to experience the same pain.

title.children: 'They are killing our veterans': Defence widow issues desperate plea for more support

image.altText: People stand around the edge of a deep crater in the sand

props.synopsis: At least 19 people have been killed in the camp in Khan Younis, in the designated humanitarian "safe zone" of Gaza where Israel's military had told hundreds of thousands of Palestinians to shelter.

title.children: 'Entire families disappeared under the sand' as Israeli strikes hit Gazan tent camp

image.altText: A bright orange globe and streak of light show where a drone was shot down over a city at night.

props.synopsis: NATO countries are becoming increasingly vocal about their capabilities to shoot down Russia drones and missiles, as Romania and Latvia become the latest members of the Western alliance to report Moscow violated their airspace.

title.children: Russian drones are entering NATO airspace, and some members say it's their 'duty' to respond

image.altText: A white woman with short brown hair looking into the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: Many neurodivergent people with eating disorders say traditional treatments haven't considered their unique needs. Now there's a push towards a more tailored approach.

title.children: Traditional treatment for eating disorders left Lisa traumatised. She wants other neurodivergent people to know 'there's a way out'

image.altText: The sea of yellow 'pope' umbrellas

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands flock to Timor-Leste's capital to welcome Pope Francis as he holds a mass in the world's most Catholic nation outside of the Vatican.

title.children: Thousands gather under sea of 'pope umbrellas' as pontiff performs mass in Dili

image.altText: The Princess of Wales and her family sit smiling at the camera in a rural setting with green trees in the background

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales confirms she is no longer receiving chemotherapy, and says she will return to a light program of external engagements in the coming months.

title.children: Princess of Wales no longer receiving chemotherapy and 'doing what I can to stay cancer free'

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks at a lectern into a microphone.

props.synopsis: A shake-up of the state election board in Georgia means it's now controlled by Republicans, who are changing voting rules. Democrats say it could be an attempt to "rig" the result.

title.children: This man stood up to Donald Trump after the 2020 election — and Brad Raffensperger says he'd do it all again

image.altText: A younger woman's hand holding an elderly patient's hand.

props.synopsis: The federal opposition has raised fresh concerns about proposed widespread reform to the aged care sector, leaving the immediate future of the promised new Aged Care Act up in the air.

title.children: Coalition flags unnamed concerns about aged care reforms, leaving sector in limbo

image.altText: Jacob Hersant, wearing a blue suit jacket and white shirt, walks beside a woman in a striped shirt.

props.synopsis: Jacob Hersant is accused of performing a Nazi salute in October last year, just days after the Victorian government banned the gesture.

title.children: First-ever Victorian charged over making Nazi salute launches legal defence in court

image.altText: Darth Vader, Lando and Boba Fett having a conversation.

props.synopsis: The veteran actor died at 93 but his legacy lives on in the iconic characters that he brought to life with his trademark voice and on-screen presence.

title.children: From Mufasa to Darth Vader, here are some of James Earl Jones's most iconic characters

image.altText: A man and two boys stand with a football and photo frame in the midst of massed sunflowers in front of a billboard

props.synopsis: Jarwin Rooney was just 14 when he was injured in the car crash that killed his mum. He hopes his story will remind drivers to think of others, as new data shows 40 per cent admit to breaking the law more frequently on regional roads.

title.children: 'These are people's lives': Teen whose mother died in crash implores drivers to make safer choices

image.altText: Smiling man in a suit with a suspension bridge behind him.

props.synopsis: Former Launceston mayor and current councillor Danny Gibson has been asked to step down after claims he sexted with a school theatre student, and other unwanted sexual advances towards young men.

title.children: Launceston mayor asks councillor to resign in 'best interests' of community in wake of historical allegations of unwanted sexual advances

image.altText: A still from a video appearing to show former SA Liberal leader David Speirs leaning over a plate and snorting.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia says he has been assured that a video allegedly showing his predecessor David Speirs snorting powder off a plate is a "deepfake", and that he has advised Mr Speirs to report it to authorities.

title.children: Snorting video appearing to show former SA opposition leader a 'complete shock' to Liberal successor

image.altText: A woman stands outside her home in pink

props.synopsis: This Queensland woman found the home she wanted, packed up and moved. But there was one problem — she was sold the property next door.

title.children: Woman sold the wrong house wants more regulation of property transactions

image.altText: Thmib1

props.synopsis: The Miami Dolphins have hit out at police after footage of star NFL wide receiver Tyreek Hill being arrested appeared to show excessive force being used.

title.children: Body camera footage shows arrest of NFL star Tyreek Hill as police criticised for using excessive force

image.altText: Entire cabinet

props.synopsis: The new Northern Territory government's ministry will not include a string of major portfolios, instead favouring new positions aimed at boosting the economy.

title.children: Climate change and remote housing portfolios scrapped in NT government's new ministry

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses and camouflage jacket walks down the stairs

props.synopsis: Four years after charges were dropped against the heir to the Red Bull empire over an alleged hit-and-run, eight people are under scrutiny, accused of helping him avoid court.

title.children: The Red Bull heir was accused of killing a cop. Now eight people who allegedly got him off the hook are on trial

image.altText: A smiling young man and a happy woman hug affectionately.

props.synopsis: Amid widespread elevated distress, Australia's new draft National Suicide Prevention Strategy, released today, focuses on a fundamental change to dealing with the social and economic factors behind feelings of hopelessness.

title.children: 'I wasn't mentally ill': Mum who considered taking own life has a message we need to hear

image.altText: A purple, yellow and grey train moves along railway tracks in a rural setting.

props.synopsis: An owner of an e-bike taken by another passenger says luggage tags are rarely handed out on the Warrnambool line, meaning conductors have no way to keep track of checked items.

title.children: V/Line commuter whose $3,800 e-bike was allegedly given to wrong passenger might only get $600 back

image.altText: A wet fur seal sits on a concrete mooring and points its nose up to the sky.

props.synopsis: A team of Indigenous rangers are working with scientists to understand just how much wildlife still exists at Gamay, also known as Sydney's Botany Bay.

title.children: In one of the most industrialised parts of Australia wildlife still flourishes
